answers.answer: The primary methods for supporting a child psychologically are to hug, explain, and distract them. Remember that calm parents lead to calm children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Parents should explain their emotions according to the child's age, for example, by saying "I'm sad, I'm upset. Mom needs to be a little sad now. If you want - hug me. If not, go play." This helps the child understand that parents also have different emotions and that this is normal.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Key tips include surrounding the child with love and care, providing tactile contact for young children, maintaining a daily routine as much as possible, understanding misbehavior as an expression of feelings, and taking care of your own physical and mental health.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under '5 useful tips: how to help children feel more protected in an emergency'.

answers.answer: Maintaining a consistent daily routine helps recreate the sequence of the day, which gives a child a sense of control over their own life and contributes to their feeling of security during uncertain times.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'How can parents support a child?'.

answers.answer: Parents should prioritize self-care practices such as ensuring adequate sleep, food, and communication, as their physical and mental well-being directly impacts their ability to support their children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'Tips for parents'.

answers.answer: Parents should ask for help if they need support and communicate their emotions and experiences to important people, such as family and friends, when they are worried or upset.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'Tips for parents'.

answers.answer: Parents can collaborate by defining routes to the shelter, deciding the child's sequence of actions, speaking in short, clear phrases, and drawing a map of the shelter to show locations and functionalities, as children perceive visuals better.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'How can parents support a child?'.

answers.answer: Parents can observe by asking open-ended questions and monitoring emotional response and activity. If a child is in stupor, they can ask three simple questions to return them to verbal response, massage fingertips or earlobes, offer a game or task, provide drinks or food, and hug them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'How can parents support a child?'.

answers.answer: Parents should acknowledge a child's worries or anger by saying, "I see / I understand you're scared / angry," rather than dismissing their feelings. They should avoid making promises that do not depend on them, like "everything will be fine," and instead affirm "whatever happens, the main thing is that we have each other."
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'How can parents support a child?'.

answers.answer: Parents can teach "Butterfly hugs" and "Cocoon" for self-calming through body contact. They can also guide breathing exercises, such as inhaling through the nose and slowly exhaling through the mouth with sounds like "A" or "O," breathing several times into the abdomen to restore stable breathing.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'How can parents support a child?'.

answers.answer: Parental calmness is significant because children copy their parents' behavior, meaning calm parents foster calm children. It is important for a child to understand that their parent is calm and has a plan of action, which helps them feel more secure.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read the section under 'How can parents support a child?'.

answers.answer: Allowing children to play or draw 'war' helps them cope with emotions and reduce anxiety and stress because it provides a way for their feelings to be played out, shouted, voiced, or drawn out.
